Looks like there's a problem with this pull request
@markusweimer Done. Could you please take another look at it? Thank you!
I'll try this.

I get a build failure when running `mvn -DskipTests -PDotNET -PBridge clean install`:

```
[INFO] Compiling 40 source files to C:\src\reef\lang\java\reef-tests\target\classes
[INFO] Compiling 7 source files to C:\src\reef\lang\java\reef-examples-clr\target\classes
C:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild\Microsoft.Cpp\v4.0\V110\Microsoft.CppCommon.targets(347,5): error MSB6006: "CL.exe" exited with code -1073741515. [C:\src\reef\lang\cpp\reef-bridge-clr\src\main\Cpp\CppBridge\JavaClrBridge\JavaClrBridge.vcxproj]
Done Building Project "C:\src\reef\lang\cpp\reef-bridge-clr\src\main\Cpp\CppBridge\JavaClrBridge\JavaClrBridge.vcxproj" (default targets) -- FAILED.
Done Building Project "C:\src\reef\lang\cpp\reef-bridge-clr\src\main\Cpp\CppBridge\JavaClrBridge\JavaClrBridge.vcxproj.metaproj" (default targets) -- FAILED.
Done Building Project "C:\src\reef\lang\cpp\reef-bridge-clr\src\main\Cpp\CppBridge\JavaClrBridge\JavaClrBridge.sln" (default targets) -- FAILED.

Build FAILED.
```
Addressd NuGet loading issue during the build.

I got a little further now, but the build still fails:

```
 C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 11.0\VC\bin\x86_amd64\link.exe /ERRORREPORT:QUEUE /OUT:"..\..\..\..\..\target\classes\JavaClrBridge.dll" /INCREMENTAL:NO /NOLOGO kernel32.lib user32.lib gdi32.lib winspool.lib comdlg32.lib advapi32.lib shell32.lib ole32.lib oleaut32.lib uuid.lib odbc32.lib odbccp32.lib /MANIFEST /MANIFESTUAC:"level='asInvoker' uiAccess='false'" /manifest:embed /PDB:"D:\src\reef\lang\cpp\reef-bridge-clr\src\main\Cpp\CppBridge\JavaClrBridge\x64\Release\JavaClrBridge.pdb" /TLBID:1 /DYNAMICBASE /FIXED:NO /NXCOMPAT /MACHINE:X64 /DLL x64\Release\ActiveContextClr2Java.obj
  x64\Release\AllocatedEvaluatorClr2Java.obj
  x64\Release\AssemblyInfo.obj
  x64\Release\AssemblyUtil.obj
  x64\Release\BinaryUtil.obj
  x64\Release\ClosedContextClr2Java.obj
  x64\Release\CommonUtilities.obj
  x64\Release\CompletedEvaluatorClr2Java.obj
  x64\Release\CompletedTaskClr2Java.obj
  x64\Release\ContextMessageClr2Java.obj
  x64\Release\EvaluatorRequestorClr2Java.obj
  x64\Release\FailedContextClr2Java.obj
  x64\Release\FailedEvaluatorClr2Java.obj
  x64\Release\FailedTaskClr2Java.obj
  x64\Release\HttpServerClr2Java.obj
  x64\Release\InteropLogger.obj
  x64\Release\InteropReturnInfo.obj
  x64\Release\InteropUtil.obj
  x64\Release\JavaClrBridge.obj
  x64\Release\RunningTaskClr2Java.obj
  x64\Release\SuspendedTaskClr2Java.obj
  x64\Release\TaskMessageClr2Java.obj
  "x64\Release\.NETFramework,Version=v4.5.AssemblyAttributes.obj"
LINK : fatal error LNK1181: cannot open input file 'gdi32.lib' [D:\src\reef\lang\cpp\reef-bridge-clr\src\main\Cpp\CppBridge\JavaClrBridge\JavaClrBridge.vcxproj]
Done Building Project "D:\src\reef\lang\cpp\reef-bridge-clr\src\main\Cpp\CppBridge\JavaClrBridge\JavaClrBridge.vcxproj" (default targets) -- FAILED.
Done Building Project "D:\src\reef\lang\cpp\reef-bridge-clr\src\main\Cpp\CppBridge\JavaClrBridge\JavaClrBridge.vcxproj.metaproj" (default targets) -- FAILED.
Done Building Project "D:\src\reef\lang\cpp\reef-bridge-clr\src\main\Cpp\CppBridge\JavaClrBridge\JavaClrBridge.sln" (default targets) -- FAILED.
```

This is confusing on two levels for me:
1. It uses Visual Studio 11.0 tools. Aren't we using VS 2013, also known as VS 12?
2. It complains about gdi? How come we even use that?

A couple of comments regarding several places in the code:
- Please remove all `@author` tags.
- Please replace `System.*print*` with logging.
- There are many variables that could be `final` that aren't. IntelliJ idea can automatically fix this.
- There are some commented out code pieces.
-  `BindException` doesn't have to be caught anymore. 

Also, we should rethink the placement of this code. Right now, the PR puts it into its own package, including examples. Let's discuss that question over on JIRA for broader exposure.
Updated cpp sln and project to VS 2013 and changed ToolsVersion="12.0" . Change has been pushed in.

[Reef-pull-request-windows #65](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-windows/65/) UNSTABLE
Looks like there's a problem with this pull request
The most recent changes worked, if I follow the [build instructions](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/REEF/Compiling+REEF). I will merge this.
I'll create a pointer at https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-90 for you.
Never mind, I didn't know non-committers could also create one.

[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #234](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/234/) FAILURE
Looks like there's a problem with this pull request
There is a typo in the folder names. It should be `Apache`, not `APache`

A couple more comments:
- We should use `Org.Apache.REEF`, not `Org.Apache.Reef`. 
- The `Org.Apache.Reef.Tang.Tests` package uses the name space `Org.Apache.Reef.Tang.Test`, which should really be `Org.Apache.REEF.Tang.Tests` for both the namespace and the project name.
I'll merge this.

Uhm, turns our that I won't merge this :-). When I run `mvn clean site:site`, I get the following error:

```
[INFO] Scanning for projects...
[ERROR] The build could not read 1 project -> [Help 1]
[ERROR]
[ERROR]   The project  (D:\src\reef\website\pom.xml) has 1 error
[ERROR]     Non-parseable POM D:\src\reef\website\pom.xml: end tag name </version> must match start tag name <name> from line 22 (position: TEXT seen ...<name>REEF Website</version>... @22:33)  @ line 22, column 33 -> [Help 2]
[ERROR]
[ERROR] To see the full stack trace of the errors, re-run Maven with the -e switch.
[ERROR] Re-run Maven using the -X switch to enable full debug logging.
[ERROR]
[ERROR] For more information about the errors and possible solutions, please read the following articles:
[ERROR] [Help 1] http://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/ProjectBuildingException
[ERROR] [Help 2] http://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/ModelParseException
```
Nevermind, I fixed the issue on my end and will merge the fixed version.
#68 is created to address review comments and updated Tang subfolder name spaces.

[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #235](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/235/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good

[Reef-pull-request-windows #68](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-windows/68/) UNSTABLE
Looks like there's a problem with this pull request

- `Org.Apache.REEF.Common`,  `Org.Apache.REEF.Driver`, `Org.Apache.REEF.Tang`,  `Org.Apache.REEF.Wake` and  `Org.Apache.REEF.Wake.Tests`  have classes which are not in the namespace their place in the file system would suggest. I'll file JIRAs for each of these to be fixed at a later time. 
- Also, `mvn apache-rat:check` doesn't pass for me on this. I will file another JIRA for that, too.

As most of the work can be done at later JIRAs, I will merge this.

I will work on merging this, including some minor changes to it (the `Tasks` project still uses the wrong DLL and namespace name).

@jwang98052 I updated `O.A.R.Examples.Tasks` to use that namespace and DLL name. This broke two tests in Tang. This is unfortunate because Tang should not depend on REEF, just the other way around. Can you have a look at clean that up before we merge this? I pushed my changes into your branch.

The RAT checks don't pass for me. The following offending files where found:

```
lang/cpp/reef-bridge-clr/src/main/Cpp/CppBridge/JavaClrBridge/x64/Release/JavaClrBridge.Build.CppClean.log
lang/cpp/reef-bridge-clr/src/main/Cpp/CppBridge/JavaClrBridge/x64/Release/JavaClrBridge.tlog/JavaClrBridge.lastbuildstate
lang/cpp/reef-bridge-clr/src/main/CSharp/CSharp/ClrHandler/obj/Release/ClrHandler.csproj.FileListAbsolute.txt
lang/cpp/reef-bridge-clr/src/main/CSharp/CSharp/ClrHandler/obj/Release/ClrHandler.csprojResolveAssemblyReference.cache
```
I would assume signing dlls will be in a separate PR.

@bgchun @markusweimer I think I am done with the changes. All group communication code and the corresponding unit tests are now in `reef-io`, and examples are in `nngroup` package of the `reef-examples` module. I did some major refactoring of the code and addressed all your comments.
